item.title: Report E-2024010400
item.description:
Report E-2024010400

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-24T15:11:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 16, 2024, one (1) one-gallon pail of UN1824 was punctured by a faulty skid and released approximately one half (0.5) cup of product to the dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. Crews utilized a neutralizing solution and absorbent pads to wipe down the other freight and dock floor. All undamaged freight was restacked and rewrapped for further shipment and processing. One (1) 55-gallon drum that contained the one (1) damaged 5-gallon jug and absorbent pads was labeled and staged in the terminal's waste holding room

item.title: Report E-2024010357
item.description:
Report E-2024010357

Identified by scraper @ 2024-01-22T15:12:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-01-16
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On January 16, 2024, one (1) 330-gallon tote of UN3149 was crushed in transit and released approximately four (4) gallons of product to the trailer interior and dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Hull's Environmental Services (HES) to remediate the impacted site. HES personnel re-secured the cap on the 330-gallon tote of UN3149 that was loose. Crews then deployed granular absorbent to the impacted loading dock floor and worked them in utilizing hand tools. All UN3149 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 55-gallon drums for disposal by R+L.
